benchmark_details.name: SimpsonsVQA
benchmark_details.overview: SimpsonsVQA is a novel dataset for Visual Question Answering derived from The Simpsons TV show, designed to promote inquiry-based learning. It aims to address three scenarios: answering relevant questions, identifying irrelevant questions related to images, and evaluating provided answers as correct, incorrect, or ambiguous.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To enhance interactive and immersive learning through a tailored dataset for visual question answering.

data.source: Images from The Simpsons TV show (seasons 24 to 33), generated question-answer pairs via automated methods and manual review.
data.annotation: Automated generation with subsequent manual review for accuracy on Amazon Mechanical Turk

methods: Performance benchmarking with existing VQA models
methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated based on evaluated performance on test data.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better model performance on relevant tasks.
methodology.validation: Dataset splits into training, validation, and test sets ensuring robustness.

targeted_risks.harm: Stereotyping and bias due to cultural references in The Simpsons show.
